result.execSummary:
The defendant Chas Damond Merriweather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription. 
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
No new law violations  rising to the level of probable cause.
Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following during the term of probation. All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED:  to be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chas Damond Merriweather

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Chas Damond Merriweather in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Chas Damond Merriweather.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 4 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation. 

Conditions of Probation:
- 30 DAYS condition time imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation 

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA).

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Chas Damond Merriweather in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for Dennis Murphy for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to settle cases in Waukesha before proceeding with a plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chas Damond Merriweather in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Chas Damond Merriweather in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Chas Damond Merriweather in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Chas Damond Merriweather in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chas Damond Merriweather appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
